I find Stalin and Mao pro-active, while I find Hitler re-active. There is no such thing as anti-semetism.

Robin,

You're spot on for the evil done to Germany by Versailles, and your posts on the subject are fine. Sadly German antisemitism gave Hitler other material to work with, too.

On Stalin and Mao, there is a difference, though it's a difficult one to handle: like it or not, Marxist ideals are fundamentally Christian ideals. Stalin and Mao were powerful obsessive characters in cracked up times, the result incredible horror. But no, the equivalence with Htler is false.

Best wishes,

Sal,
 
This is a good piece of work.  I'm surprised: you show good sound judgement across all your historical and social videos, where it would be easy to fly off into la-la land.

On ehing, though: you gotta work on your pronunciation of "Goebels" and "Goering." the "oe" in a German word is very often an Anglicism for the o-umlaut in German. (Why s there o good English diaeresis on my keyboard??)  The best hint I can give is "Try to say e with your mouth shaped as though for u."

What no one ever acknowledges is the reason(s) for the Genesis of the National Socialist party. Germany was bankrupt, their currency worthless, and people starving as a result of the Treaty of Versailles. It should also be noted that Germany went through diplomatic channels with other European countries to fix this to no avail. France and England declared war on Germany, not the other way around.

It might be mentioned that Ernst Roehm and the Strasser brothers represented a genuine left wing in the Nazi Party   -who took the "socialism" in National Socialism to mean the actual nationalization of German industry. Also that the SA saw themselves as the real army. In order retain the support of the German industrialists and military, Hitler sought to eliminate them and severely downsize the SA.
